isis.stitle: AIR CONDITIONING PROTECTION AND DIAGNOSTIC SYSTEM (APAds™) DESCRIPTION, OPERATION, TROUBLESHOOTING, REMOVE, INSTALL, AND ELECTRICAL CIRCUIT DIAGRAMS MAINTENANCE MANUAL - OPERATION - APADS SYSTEM OPERATION

figure.caption: Figure 4. A/C System Inputs To APADS Module

svcprocinfo.para: The APADS control system is composed of an electronic control module, two "smart" pressure switches and a conventional evaporator thermostat (TSTAT). The input signals are interpreted by control and diagnostic algorithms which drive outputs to the A/C clutch coil and diagnostic LEDs. In the APADS system, the module becomes the only device through which power is switched to the A/C clutch coil.

svcsubproc.title: Inputs:
svcsubproc.para: Pressure Switches: High pressure cutoff switch and Low pressure switch, both are normally closed. These "smart" pressure devices have an internal resistor installed in parallel with the electrical contacts to allow diagnosing of sensor, wiring and connector faults. Both switches are configured to provide a current path to ground when they are closed.

note.para: Actual set and rest pressure are application specific.

svcsubproc.para: TSTAT: The evaporator thermostat is the main A/C control. The TSTAT is wired in series with the A/C system ON/OFF switch. These switches are configured to switch to battery voltage when A/C compressor operation is desired.
